intro: Phacelia keckii, commonly known as Keck's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Phacelia keckii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
